Example :
<https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=careers.planisware.com>
<https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=www.planisware.com>
Might be the issuer? The SSL for HS is Cloudflare SSL ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
im not too familiar with SSL's but thats the main thing I can think of from a top level

<@U3TR96G84> this may help <https://www.ssl.com/article/comparing-ecdsa-vs-rsa/>  looks like the RSA method (regular domain) seems like it is better in the categories below vs the ECDSA (subdomain) method. Might be the reasoning
Thanks for your help <@U2H3TT8F2> you rock

for the story : “I’m working with the Dutch firm that contracts HubSpot... and the french part in charge with the global website told that maybe HS is not enough secure...” As I’m not an expert with SSL issue I just want to have some feedback about differencies :slightly_smiling_face:

Good morning, I'm creating a landing page for a client that has videos cascading down the page on the left and right side (you can see the page in development here: <http://web.clearchanneloutdoor.com/radar-landing-page>). However for mobile, they would like to change the stacking order so that it stacks video, then text, then video, then text etc... So is there a way to change this stacking order for mobile without putting in new modules into the template?
Here are some videos of what it looks like on desktop / mobile
to showcase what I mean

There's a few options. I prefer a CSS approach, using either flex or CSS grid. These both allow for content reordering based on @media queries, read more here: <https://css-tricks.com/almanac/properties/o/order/>

Another option would be duplicating the container and showing one for desktop and another for mobile, obviously using @media queries to show and hide based on the viewport.

The former approach is cleaner in terms of HTML markup, the latter may be a little more "plug-and-play" for your existing styles
Use flex order
Ah Mark beat me to it
lol, sorry dude :wink:
You’ll rue this day Mark!
:flushed:
What is flex-order ?
is that a css property <@U26DA9CQ0>?
a flex-box property?
If you have an element inside of a parent with display:flex; you can change its order using flex-order:1;
cmd+F here (I can't tell you how many times I've referenced this page) <https://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/a-guide-to-flexbox/>
Yeah that guide has everything you need to know
ok <@U26BLKGE4> - thanks so much
appreciate you

Has anyone messed with the flexible pattern urls in the URL Mappings tool? Overall, we are getting duplicate content errors and its due to the fact that things on the blog like (using HS for an example) <https://blog.HubSpot.com/marketing> and <https://blog.HubSpot.com/marketing/page/1> are the same. I see that HS has taken care of this though, how would I set this up in the URL mapping to do the same?
:thumbsup:
also be sure to use an autoprefixer if messing with flex; support is good but there can be a lot of vender differences between browsers
This honestly seems like something HS should do by default for all blogs

I'm assuming I would have to create three redirects total to accomplish this:
```
<https://blog.domain.com/page/1> -- > <https://blog.domain.com/>
<https://blog.domain.com/topic/*/page/1> --> <https://blog.domain.com/topic/*/>
<https://blog.domain.com/author/*/page/1> --> <https://blog.domain.com/author/*/>
```

Is there any additional documentation on the flexible pattern URLS? Maybe something with supported tokens you can use?
Also, how long do redirects take when added in HS?
seems like about 2 minutes in my experience
its been going on a good 10 -12 mins here lol
:confused: maybe it’s like queued, so if you’re changing a bunch, or a lot of people are changing redirects it does one at a time in order or something
nope, im an idiot (as usual) its under the advanced setting with the "Ignore this URL mapping if a page exists at the requested URL"
totally forgot about that
that worked great <@U26BLKGE4> and <@U26DA9CQ0> - thank you both
very cool solution
will use this again
Support also said they couldnt share the url mappings that HS uses to accomplish this, so once I figure it out, ill post here in case others need it
well that’s bizarre
glad to hear it!
agreed, i could see if its asking for source code on how a page is build but with something like asking about what the flexible patterns are for the urls, its not a company secret lol
yea, my only guess is maybe they misinterpreted it. “he wants to know the internal structure of how we make pages appear at their URLs….the logic, everything.” “security team says just say ‘no’”
ok figured it out, write up incoming.

The reason for doing this is to reduce the duplicate content errors you'll get from tools like SEMRush and Moz. Essentially, you have to make sure you check off the `Ignore this URL mapping if a page exists at the requested URL` under advanced options. but you are generally creating 3 redirects.

1 - a redirect from your main blog url's page 1 url to the main blog

the next two are flexible pattern urls (here you actually choose a token by using the `:` in front of a part of the url

2 - create flexible pattern for the author url pattern
3 - create flexible pattern for the topic url pattern

see screenshot for how I did the flex patterns (you can name the token whatever you want.

Hope this helps others.
*TL;DR* - SEMRush / Moz will say you have duplicate content, creating 1 redirect for your main listing and 2 flexible pattern redirects can solve this issue for you.
you must have some huge SEO project going on.
Yea, they tasked me with looking into the SEMRush/Moz/Search Console errors for the HS Platform,... it was alot
so with that, if anyone from HS wants to reach out, i'd be happy to chat with them on what I am doing to fix all the issues (as I know we and our clients arent the only ones with these)
Really interested in your feedback, would love to see your notes or if you wanted to put together a blog :wink:
Yea, im writing up a blog on all that I am doing on this
Ill totally post to here once I finish it all up
is there a way to require captcha from a higher level than the form so i dont have to go through 50 forms and select it?
lol.. global form changes has been a request a few times. But i think its not gonna happen any time soon.
Hi, channel. Does anyone with experience using the HubSpot/Vidyard integration know how to turn off *autoplay* on a video?
Is there a way to use the menu menu with HubSpot’s default navigation? Does anyone have experience with that?
Mega menu I mean

yes, it’s possible, it’s hard though.

One method is to have the  pull downs be separate rows with groups below the main nav menu, then you use more menus for the children.

Or you could go insane with javascript wizardry to fully restructure the menu to create the layout you need.
Huh - ok
Or I’ve also seen people use HubDB to render menus as well. just be aware if you use HubDB then you use up one of your 10 HubDB query limit on ever page
thanks <@U7SL518D6>
do you have a recommendation?

go the route that you feel most comfortable with. If you’re a pro with javascript then going the restructuring route might be the right choice for you. If you basically just get by with javascript then doing the row groups below the main nav is an easyish method - you just basically toggle the display of those groups based on the main menu items being hovered.
My 2¢, I always recommend using HubDB if it's available, way easier to manage in my opinion
here’s another idea- you could create a custom module for making mega menus - can’t say it’d be easy, but hey if you make it generic enough you could re-use it for other projects
HubSpot themselves use a HubDB table for their mega menu
that’s good to know
Menu structures just lend themselves to naturally to object markup. I know many of us wish the advanced menu tools actually output an object rather than actual markup.
ok thanks <@U2H3TT8F2>
I still don’t know why they haven’t given us this option yet
It’s on our radar

Question: client wants to move existing blog to HS, new blog is at a different URL than the old one - does anyone have a good method for redirecting old blog post URLs to HS URLs?

I would think it’d be great if you can do a redirect like /blog/[post-slug]
<http://newblogurl.com/blog/[post-slug]|newblogurl.com/blog/[post-slug]>
old site is a WP site
nvm answered my own question quite quickly
look at you go
is it possible for HS to minify the following .js file thats on everyones portal: `<https://js.hs-scripts.com/[portalID].js>`
Check top two results: <https://www.google.com/search?safe=off&q=how+to+build+a+mega+menu+in+HubSpot+CMS&spell=1&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiSlqXL6M_eAhWiiVQKHZfYDykQBQgwKAA&biw=1447&bih=774>
I just ask because its another resource that SEMRush is flagging as a warning for not being compressed/minified

I would love to know if there is someone at HS I could lean on to show them a SEMRush report and discuss some options for fixing these errors (as i know on other platforms [cough cough wordpress], some of these errors are easily fixed but its harder on HS and it deals mainly with Duplicate issues (like content, titles, metas, and more)
cc <@U6TBZ66FN>
looking

I've also added an idea on the forums to help with fixing these issues: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/lt-title-gt-builder-for-blog-author-and-topic-listing-pages/idi-p/216251#M24960>

Thanks <@U22PKFRU5>, I have sent an invite 2 weeks ago. No answer. But, I'm still full of hope!

<@UD53A9UUR> In fact, this is not a bug... the steps in the blog post are not very clear, so I don't know if did my custom module set up correctly... Just want to confirm with James if I'm on the right way.

Hi Ya'll :wave: Hope you're having a great Monday!
> Love custom modules?
> Want to see some creative ones community members have built?

We have x3 community-built custom modules that entered into a fun little community contest.
Now we need you, the community, to review the code :matrix: and vote on them to determine a winner. :trophy:
> Please check them out and vote :point_right: <https://lukesummerfield.typeform.com/to/DVXFXu>
Hi <@UDU6KEBFB>, thanks for your feedback on the article. Feel free to DM me with the roadblock(s) you're running into and we can go from there.
Is there a reason the custom module form element doesn't have the same options as the default form element? i.e. send a follow-up email
